sections.title: Attributes
sections.content:
Attributes

 InnerAttribute ::=
 $$#![$$ AttributeContent $$]$$

 OuterAttributeOrDoc ::=
 OuterAttribute
 | OuterBuiltinAttribute
 | OuterBlockDoc
 | OuterLineDoc

 OuterAttribute ::=
 $$#[$$ AttributeContent $$]$$

 AttributeContent ::=
 SimplePath AttributeInput?

 AttributeInput ::=
 $$($$ TokenTree* $$)$$
 | $$=$$ Expression

 AttributeContentList ::=
 AttributeContent ($$,$$ AttributeContent)* $$,$$?

An attribute is a general, free-form metadatum that is interpreted based on
its name, convention, language, and tool.

An inner attribute is an attribute that applies to an enclosing
item.

An outer attribute is an attribute that applies to a subsequent
item.

An attribute content is a construct that provides the content of
an attribute.

paragraphs.fls_rnzxj1t0hehl: An attribute is a general, free-form metadatum that is interpreted based on its name, convention, language, and tool.
paragraphs.fls_yd0ehw5csaur: An inner attribute is an attribute that applies to an enclosing item.
paragraphs.fls_8o6vmzbw1b1j: An outer attribute is an attribute that applies to a subsequent item.
paragraphs.fls_9TMRVlQwAdTB: An attribute content is a construct that provides the content of an attribute.

paragraphs.syntax_1:
InnerAttributeOrDoc ::=
       InnerAttribute
     | InnerBuiltinAttribute
     | InnerBlockDoc
     | InnerLineDoc

   InnerAttribute ::=
       $$#![$$ AttributeContent $$]$$

   OuterAttributeOrDoc ::=
       OuterAttribute
     | OuterBuiltinAttribute
     | OuterBlockDoc
     | OuterLineDoc

   OuterAttribute ::=
       $$#[$$ AttributeContent $$]$$

   AttributeContent ::=
       SimplePath AttributeInput?

   AttributeInput ::=
       $$($$ TokenTree* $$)$$
     | $$=$$ Expression

   Att...

sections.title: Attribute Properties
sections.content:
Attribute Properties

An active attribute is an attribute that is removed from the item
it decorates.

An inert attribute is an attribute that remains with the item
it decorates.

The following [attribute]s are [active attribute]s:

* [Attribute macro]s.

* Attribute cfg.

* Attribute cfg_attr.

Attribute test is an inert attribute when compiling for testing
purposes, otherwise it is an active attribute.

All remaining [attribute]s are [inert attribute]s.

paragraphs.fls_p4potvq7x532: An active attribute is an attribute that is removed from the item it decorates.
paragraphs.fls_xk7lb2g02sy7: An inert attribute is an attribute that remains with the item it decorates.
paragraphs.fls_4xu1rwecd9au: Attribute test is an inert attribute when compiling for testing purposes, otherwise it is an active attribute.

sections.title: Built-in Attributes
sections.content:
Built-in Attributes

 OuterBuiltinAttribute ::=
 $$#[$$ BuiltinAttributeContent $$]$$

 BuiltinAttributeContent ::=
 AutomaticallyDerivedContent
 | CfgAttrContent
 | CfgContent
 | CollapseDebuginfoContent
 | ColdContent
 | CrateNameContent
 | CrateTypeContent
 | DeriveContent
 | DocContent
 | ExportNameContent
 | GlobalAllocatorContent
 | InlineContent
 | IgnoreContent
 | LinkContent
 | LinkNameContent
 | LinkSectionContent
 | LinkOrdinalContent
 | MacroExportContent
 | MacroUseContent
 | NakedContent
 | NoBuiltinsContent
 | NoImplicitPreludeContent
 | NoLinkContent
 | NoMainContent
 | NoMangleContent
 | NonExhaustiveContent
 | NoStdContent
 | PanicHandlerContent
 | PathContent
 | ProcMacroAttributeContent
 | ProcMacroContent
 | ProcMacroDeriveContent
 | RecursionLimitContent
 | ReprContent
 | ShouldPanicContent
 | TargetFeatureContent
 | TestContent
 | TrackCallerContent
 | TypeLengthLimitContent
 | UnsafeContent
 | UsedContent
 | WindowsSubsystemContent

A built-in attribute is a language-defined attribute.

The following [built-in attribute]s are [code generation attribute]s:

* Attribute cold.

* Attribute inline.

* Attribute no_builtins.

* Attribute target_feature.

* Attribute track_caller.

* Attribute naked.

The following [built-in attribute]s are
[conditional compilation attribute]s:

* Attribute cfg.

* Attribute cfg_attr.

The following [built-in attribute]s are [derivation attribute]s:

* Attribute automatically_derived.

* Attribute derive.

The following [built-in attribute]s are [diagnostics attribute]s:

* Attribute allow.

* Attribute deny.

* Attribute deprecated.

* Attribute forbid.

* Attribute must_use.

* Attribute warn.

* Attribute expect.

* Attribute unsafe.

The following [built-in attribute]s are [documentation attribute]s:

* Attribute doc.

The following [built-in attribute]s are
[foreign function interface attribute]s:

* Attribute crate_name.

* Attribute crate_type.

* Attribute export_name.

* Attribute link.

* Attribute link_name.

* Attribute link_section.

* Attribute no_link.

* Attribute no_main.

* Attribute no_mangle.

* Attribute repr.

* Attribute used.

The following [built-in attribute]s are [limits attribute]s:

* Attribute recursion_limit.

* Attribute type_length_limit.

The following [built-in attribute]s are [macro attribute]s:

* Attribute macro_export.

* Attribute macro_use.

* Attribute proc_macro.

* Attribute proc_macro_attribute.

* Attribute proc_macro_derive.

The following [built-in attribute]s are [modules attribute]s:

* Attribute path.

The following [built-in attribute]s are [prelude attribute]s:

* Attribute no_implicit_prelude.

* Attribute no_std.

The following [built-in attribute]s are [runtime attribute]s:

* Attribute global_allocator.

* Attribute panic_handler.

* Attribute windows_subsystem.

The following [built-in attribute]s are [testing attribute]s:

* Attribute ignore.

* Attribute should_panic.

* Attribute test.

The following [built-in attribute]s are [type attribute]s:

* Attribute non_exhaustive.

paragraphs.fls_92tqo8uas8kd: A built-in attribute is a language-defined attribute.
paragraphs.fls_bxucstrfcco8: The following [built-in attribute]s are [code generation attribute]s:
paragraphs.fls_87o6n9et9jio: The following [built-in attribute]s are [conditional compilation attribute]s:
paragraphs.fls_q579e97n1m8j: The following [built-in attribute]s are [foreign function interface attribute]s:

paragraphs.syntax_1:
InnerBuiltinAttribute ::=
       $$#![$$ BuiltinAttributeContent $$]$$

   OuterBuiltinAttribute ::=
       $$#[$$ BuiltinAttributeContent $$]$$

   BuiltinAttributeContent ::=
       AutomaticallyDerivedContent
     | CfgAttrContent
     | CfgContent
     | CollapseDebuginfoContent
     | ColdContent
     | CrateNameContent
     | CrateTypeContent
     | DeriveContent
     | DocContent
     | ExportNameContent
     | GlobalAllocatorContent
     | InlineContent
     | IgnoreContent
     | LinkCo...

sections.title: Code Generation Attributes
sections.content: Code Generation Attributes

sections.title: Attribute ``cold``
sections.content:
Attribute cold

Attribute cold shall apply to [function]s.

Attribute :dc:`cold` indicates that its related function is unlikely
to be called.

paragraphs.fls_8zdexi5lgm2f: Attribute :dc:cold indicates that its related function is unlikely to be called.

sections.title: Attribute ``inline``
sections.content:
Attribute inline

 InlineHint ::=
 $$($$ ($$always$$ | $$never$$) $$)$$

Attribute inline shall apply to [closure expression]s and
[function]s.

Attribute :dc:`inline` marks its related function as inlined.
The process of replacing a call expression to an inlined function
with the function body is referred to as inlining.

Attribute inline without an InlineHint suggests to a tool that
inlining should be performed.

Attribute inline with InlineHint always suggests to a tool
that inlining should always be performed.

Attribute inline with InlineHint never suggests to a tool
that inlining should never be performed.

A tool is not obliged to perform inlining.

paragraphs.fls_jwyhky49ssup: Attribute inline shall apply to [closure expression]s and [function]s.
paragraphs.fls_s7bf7tf9206d: Attribute :dc:inline marks its related function as inlined. The process of replacing a call expression to an inlined function with the function body is referred to as inlining.
paragraphs.fls_930o6urn669w: Attribute inline without an InlineHint suggests to a tool that inlining should be performed.
paragraphs.fls_z7ufiqqujgdh: Attribute inline with InlineHint always suggests to a tool that inlining should always be performed.
paragraphs.fls_f0n4g5uky9tp: Attribute inline with InlineHint never suggests to a tool that inlining should never be performed.
paragraphs.fls_r3p4din7rjz8: A tool is not obliged to perform inlining.

sections.title: Attribute ``no_builtins``
sections.content:
Attribute no_builtins

Attribute no_builtins shall apply to the crate root module.

Attribute :dc:`no_builtins` prevents the tool from replacing certain code
patterns with calls to intrinsic functions.

paragraphs.fls_x36c6j1ivbvp: Attribute no_builtins shall apply to the crate root module.
paragraphs.fls_k2k10qtn6f0g: Attribute :dc:no_builtins prevents the tool from replacing certain code patterns with calls to intrinsic functions.

sections.title: Attribute ``target_feature``
sections.content:
Attribute target_feature

 FeatureList ::=
 Feature ($$,$$ Feature)*

 Feature ::=
 $$adx$$
 | $$aes$$
 | $$avx$$
 | $$avx2$$
 | $$avx512bf16$$
 | $$avx512bitalg$$
 | $$avx512bw$$
 | $$avx512cd$$
 | $$avx512dq$$
 | $$avx512f$$
 | $$avx512fp16$$
 | $$avx512ifma$$
 | $$avx512vbmi$$
 | $$avx512vbmi2$$
 | $$avx512vl$$
 | $$avx512vnni$$
 | $$avx512vp2intersect$$
 | $$avx512vpopcntdq$$
 | $$avxifma$$
 | $$avxneconvert$$
 | $$avxvnni$$
 | $$avxvnniint16$$
 | $$avxvnniint8$$
 | $$bmi1$$
 | $$bmi2$$
 | $$fma$$
 | $$fxsr$$
 | $$gfni$$
 | $$kl$$
 | $$lzcnt$$
 | $$pclmulqdq$$
 | $$popcnt$$
 | $$rdrand$$
 | $$rdseed$$
 | $$sha$$
 | $$sha512$$
 | $$sm3$$
 | $$sm4$$
 | $$sse$$
 | $$sse2$$
 | $$sse3$$
 | $$sse4.1$$
 | $$sse4.2$$
 | $$sse4a$$
 | $$ssse3$$
 | $$tbm$$
 | $$vaes$$
 | $$vpclmulqdq$$
 | $$widekl$$
 | $$xsave$$
 | $$xsavec$$
 | $$xsaveopt$$
 | $$xsaves$$

Safe [function]s that are annotated with [target_feature]s
can only be called without an unsafe block by a caller that is within a function
that enables all the [target_feature]s that the callee enables.

Attribute :dc:`target_feature` enables target architecture features for its
related function.

The target architecture features are as follows:

It is undefined behavior to execute a program compiled with target architecture
features that are not supported.

paragraphs.fls_3qj3jvmtxvx6: Safe [function]s that are annotated with [target_feature]s can only be called without an unsafe block by a caller that is within a function that enables all the [target_feature]s that the callee enables.
paragraphs.fls_agpkz1v3c281: Attribute :dc:target_feature enables target architecture features for its related function.
paragraphs.fls_91b7nd6qslsb: The target architecture features are as follows: .. list-table:: -

paragraphs.fls_8HPcvIaahaB9: - avx512bf16 - avx512bw - Advanced Vector Extensions 512-bit - Bfloat16 Extensions -

paragraphs.fls_fh7i1Pcmqjdm: - avx512bw - avx512f - Advanced Vector Extensions 512-bit - Byte and Word Instructions -

paragraphs.fls_xWcGvl83bVWC: - avx512dq - avx512f - Advanced Vector Extensions 512-bit - Doubleword and Quadword Instructions -
paragraphs.fls_5CVTkOoLHAvW: - avx512f - avx2, fma, f16c - Advanced Vector Extensions 512-bit - Foundation -
paragraphs.fls_hThb8qn820wJ: - avx512fp16 - avx512bw - Advanced Vector Extensions 512-bit - Float16 Extensions -
paragraphs.fls_1T0VYMtG3loD: - avx512ifma - avx512f - Advanced Vector Extensions 512-bit - Integer Fused Multiply Add -
paragraphs.fls_AlBD9ckWKecQ: - avx512vbmi - avx512bw - Advanced Vector Extensions 512-bit - Vector Byte Manipulation Instructions -
paragraphs.fls_72cwAExPDMQ8: - avx512vbmi2 - avx512bw - Advanced Vector Extensions 512-bit - Vector Byte Manipulation Instructions 2 -
paragraphs.fls_pSSIwmUAnUly: - avx512vl - avx512f - Advanced Vector Extensions 512-bit - Vector Length Extensions -

paragraphs.fls_G4aOoX8a7i7r: - avxvnniint8 - avx2 - Advanced Vector Extensions - Vector Neural Network Instructions with 8-bit Integers -

paragraphs.syntax_1:
TargetFeatureContent ::=
       $$target_feature$$ $$($$ $$enable$$ $$=$$ $$"$$ FeatureList $$"$$ $$)$$

   FeatureList ::=
       Feature ($$,$$ Feature)*

   Feature ::=
       $$adx$$
     | $$aes$$
     | $$avx$$
     | $$avx2$$
     | $$avx512bf16$$
     | $$avx512bitalg$$
     | $$avx512bw$$
     | $$avx512cd$$
     | $$avx512dq$$
     | $$avx512f$$
     | $$avx512fp16$$
     | $$avx512ifma$$
     | $$avx512vbmi$$
     | $$avx512vbmi2$$
     | $$avx512vl$$
     | $$avx512vnni$$
     | $$av...

sections.title: Attribute ``track_caller``
sections.content:
Attribute track_caller

Attribute track_caller shall apply to non-[main function]s with
ABI "Rust".

Attribute :dc:`track_caller` allows the function body of its
related function to obtain a core::panic::Location which indicates
the topmost untracked caller that ultimately led to the invocation of the
function.

A tool is not required to implement this indication in an effective manner.

When applied to an associated trait function, attribute
track_caller applies to all [associated function]s of the
implemented trait. If the associated trait function has a default
implementation, then the attribute applies to all overriding
[function]s.

It is undefined behavior when attribute track_caller applies to an
external function but does not apply to all linked [implementation]s.

It is undefined behavior when attribute track_caller is applied to
an exported function but the external function it links to is missing
the attribute.

paragraphs.fls_h8yepgchjxv9: Attribute track_caller shall apply to non-[main function]s with ABI "Rust".
paragraphs.fls_w1pxtzp7acty: Attribute :dc:track_caller allows the function body of its related function to obtain a core::panic::Location which indicates the topmost untracked caller that ultimately led to the invocation of the function.
paragraphs.fls_zch43jpetmdu: A tool is not required to implement this indication in an effective manner.
paragraphs.fls_y1e258p4rby5: When applied to an associated trait function, attribute track_caller applies to all [associated function]s of the implemented trait. If the associated trait function has a default implementation, then the attribute applies to all overriding [function]s.

paragraphs.fls_vkz8t751gfhk: It is undefined behavior when attribute track_caller applies to an external function but does not apply to all linked [implementation]s.
paragraphs.fls_ddg0u5lej74x: It is undefined behavior when attribute track_caller is applied to an exported function but the external function it links to is missing the attribute.

sections.title: Attribute ``naked``
sections.content:
Attribute naked

Attribute naked shall apply to [function]s.

Attribute :dc:`naked` ensures that a function prologue and epilogue are not generated.

Attribute naked function body must consist of exactly one
macro core::arch::naked_asm call.

Attribute naked cannot be used together with [testing function]s.

Attribute naked cannot be used together with attribute inline.

Attribute naked cannot be used together with attribute track_caller.

It is a safety invariant for the function body to respect the ABI of the function.

It is a safety invariant for the function body to diverge <diverging expression>.

paragraphs.fls_WnqgR5OyecIs: Attribute :dc:naked ensures that a function prologue and epilogue are not generated.
paragraphs.fls_NCHa4Dc1M6oM: Attribute naked function body must consist of exactly one macro core::arch::naked_asm call.
paragraphs.fls_H7ccwNk2HGAi: Attribute naked cannot be used together with [testing function]s.
paragraphs.fls_ocOk47SGiRVb: Attribute naked cannot be used together with attribute inline.
paragraphs.fls_VUL2qySBvRqy: Attribute naked cannot be used together with attribute track_caller.

paragraphs.fls_0tYMAQY1V55p: It is a safety invariant for the function body to respect the ABI of the function.
paragraphs.fls_wGbJrz4OpKKb: It is a safety invariant for the function body to diverge <diverging expression>.

sections.title: Conditional Compilation Attributes
sections.content: Conditional Compilation Attributes

sections.title: Attribute ``cfg``
sections.content:
Attribute cfg

 ConfigurationPredicate ::=
 ConfigurationOption
 | ConfigurationPredicateAll
 | ConfigurationPredicateAny
 | ConfigurationPredicateNot
 | $$true$$
 | $$false$$

 ConfigurationOption ::=
 ConfigurationOptionName ConfigurationOptionValue?

 ConfigurationOptionName ::=
 Identifier

 ConfigurationOptionValue ::=
 $$=$$ StringLiteral

 ConfigurationPredicateAll ::=
 $$all$$ $$($$ ConfigurationPredicateList? $$)$$

 ConfigurationPredicateAny ::=
 $$any$$ $$($$ ConfigurationPredicateList? $$)$$

 ConfigurationPredicateNot ::=
 $$not$$ $$($$ ConfigurationPredicate $$)$$

 ConfigurationPredicateList ::=
 ConfigurationPredicate ($$,$$ ConfigurationPredicate)* $$,$$?

Attribute :dc:`cfg` enables conditional compilation.

A configuration predicate is a construct that evaluates statically
to either true or false, and controls conditional compilation.

An all configuration predicate is a configuration predicate that
models existential quantifier ALL.

An all configuration predicate evaluates statically to true when either
all nested configuration predicates evaluate to true, or there are no nested
configuration predicates.

An any configuration predicate is a configuration predicate that
models existential quantifier ANY.

An any configuration predicate evaluates statically to true when any
nested configuration predicate evaluates to true.

A not configuration predicate is a configuration predicate that
negates the Boolean value of its nested configuration predicate.

A not configuration predicate evaluates statically to true when its
nested configuration predicate evaluates to false.

Configuration predicate :dc:`true` always evaluates statically to true.

Configuration predicate :dc:`false` always evaluates statically to false.

The evaluation of a configuration option is tool-defined.

paragraphs.fls_l96kyix5xsof: A configuration predicate is a construct that evaluates statically to either true or false, and controls conditional compilation.
paragraphs.fls_y1MUhnKCxK6T: An all configuration predicate is a configuration predicate that models existential quantifier ALL.
paragraphs.fls_tncxxsyutppf: An all configuration predicate evaluates statically to true when either all nested configuration predicates evaluate to true, or there are no nested configuration predicates.
paragraphs.fls_Rp73YEE3aFdI: An any configuration predicate is a configuration predicate that models existential quantifier ANY.
paragraphs.fls_m0zxktz168e0: An any configuration predicate evaluates statically to true when any nested configuration predicate evaluates to true.
paragraphs.fls_XsxeOd32JI8x: A not configuration predicate is a configuration predicate that negates the Boolean value of its nested configuration predicate.
paragraphs.fls_tvsadfy9uibu: A not configuration predicate evaluates statically to true when its nested configuration predicate evaluates to false.
paragraphs.fls_JWx8vQwl19Fu: Configuration predicate :dc:true always evaluates statically to true.
paragraphs.fls_SziFAQsio0ab: Configuration predicate :dc:false always evaluates statically to false.
paragraphs.fls_jbl9xyynjo0g: The evaluation of a configuration option is tool-defined.

paragraphs.syntax_1:
CfgContent ::=
       $$cfg$$ $$($$ ConfigurationPredicate $$)$$

   ConfigurationPredicate ::=
       ConfigurationOption
     | ConfigurationPredicateAll
     | ConfigurationPredicateAny
     | ConfigurationPredicateNot
     | $$true$$
     | $$false$$

   ConfigurationOption ::=
       ConfigurationOptionName ConfigurationOptionValue?

   ConfigurationOptionName ::=
       Identifier

   ConfigurationOptionValue ::=
       $$=$$ StringLiteral

   ConfigurationPredicateAll ::=
       $$all$$ $...

sections.title: Attribute ``cfg_attr``
sections.content:
Attribute cfg_attr

Attribute :dc:`cfg_attr` enables conditional compilation.

An attribute cfg_attr where the related
configuration predicate evaluates to true is replaced with a new
attribute for each AttributeContent enumerated in the
[attribute]'s AttributeContentList.

paragraphs.fls_rzw12sagm585: An attribute cfg_attr where the related configuration predicate evaluates to true is replaced with a new attribute for each AttributeContent enumerated in the [attribute]'s AttributeContentList.

sections.title: Derivation Attributes
sections.content: Derivation Attributes

sections.title: Attribute ``automatically_derived``
sections.content:
Attribute automatically_derived

Attribute :dc:`automatically_derived` is automatically added to
[implementation]s that are created by attribute derive for
[built-in trait]s.

paragraphs.fls_5u1e0lkt0ab1: Attribute :dc:automatically_derived is automatically added to [implementation]s that are created by attribute derive for [built-in trait]s.

sections.title: Attribute ``derive``
sections.content:
Attribute derive

Attribute derive shall apply to [abstract data type]s.

Attribute :dc:`derive` lists [derive macro]s for automatic
implementation by a tool.

Attribute derive causes trait core::cmp::PartialEq to be
automatically implemented for struct S<T> as follows:

paragraphs.fls_4btm6zwf445a: Attribute derive shall apply to [abstract data type]s.
paragraphs.fls_pjmbmj2b35y8: Attribute :dc:derive lists [derive macro]s for automatic implementation by a tool.

paragraphs.fls_xtty2ino4vwc: Attribute derive causes trait core::cmp::PartialEq to be automatically implemented for struct S<T> as follows: .. code-block:: rust impl<T: core::cmp::PartialEq> core::cmp::PartialEq for S<T> { fn eq(&self, other: &S<T>) -> bool { self.field == other.field } fn ne(&self, other: &S<T>) -> bool { self.field != other.field } }

sections.title: Diagnostics Attributes
sections.content:
Diagnostics Attributes

Diagnostic [attribute]s are related to linting, and are not defined in
this document.

paragraphs.fls_ghumzt9ybtit: Diagnostic [attribute]s are related to linting, and are not defined in this document.

sections.title: Documentation Attributes
sections.content: Documentation Attributes

sections.title: Attribute ``doc``
sections.content:
Attribute doc

 DocInput ::=
 $$=$$ MacroInvocation
 | $$=$$ StringLiteral
 | $$($$ TokenTree* $$)$$

Attribute :dc:`doc` associates documentation with a construct.

paragraphs.fls_1ee9qjcgbwme: Attribute :dc:doc associates documentation with a construct.

paragraphs.syntax_1:
DocContent ::=
       $$doc$$ DocInput

   DocInput ::=
       $$=$$ MacroInvocation
     | $$=$$ StringLiteral
     | $$($$ TokenTree* $$)$$

sections.title: Foreign Function Interface Attributes
sections.content: Foreign Function Interface Attributes

sections.title: Attribute ``crate_name``
sections.content:
Attribute crate_name

Attribute crate_name shall apply to the crate root module.

Attribute :dc:`crate_name` shall specify the name of the related
crate.

paragraphs.fls_tsdk8jyajcg: Attribute crate_name shall apply to the crate root module.
paragraphs.fls_6riphqysh0gd: Attribute :dc:crate_name shall specify the name of the related crate.

sections.title: Attribute ``crate_type``
sections.content:
Attribute crate_type

 CrateType ::=
 $$bin$$
 | $$cdylib$$
 | $$dylib$$
 | $$lib$$
 | $$proc-macro$$
 | $$rlib$$
 | $$staticlib$$

Attribute crate_type shall apply to the crate root module.

Attribute :dc:`crate_type` shall specify the linkage type of the
crate it appears in.

paragraphs.fls_2i2g55nqqpc1: Attribute crate_type shall apply to the crate root module.
paragraphs.fls_1zziddjuzjeq: Attribute :dc:crate_type shall specify the linkage type of the crate it appears in.

sections.title: Attribute ``export_name``
sections.content:
Attribute export_name

Attribute export_name shall apply to [function]s and
[static]s.

Attribute :dc:`export_name` shall specify the exported symbol of the
related function or static.

paragraphs.fls_r3fwpuuaoeie: Attribute export_name shall apply to [function]s and [static]s.
paragraphs.fls_spwr6gf7kpds: Attribute :dc:export_name shall specify the exported symbol of the related function or static.

sections.title: Attribute ``link``
sections.content:
Attribute link

 LinkOption ::=
 NativeLibraryName
 | NativeLibraryNameWithKind
 | WebAssemblyModuleName

 NativeLibraryName ::=
 $$name$$ $$=$$ StringLiteral

 NativeLibraryNameWithKind ::=
 NativeLibraryName $$,$$ NativeLibraryKind

 WebAssemblyModuleName ::=
 $$wasm_import_module$$ $$=$$ StringLiteral

 NativeLibraryKind ::=
 $$kind$$ $$=$$ $$"$$ NativeLibraryKindType $$"$$

 NativeLibraryKindType ::=
 $$dylib$$
 | $$raw-dylib$$
 | $$framework$$
 | $$static$$

Attribute link shall apply to [external block]s.

Attribute :dc:`link` shall specify the name of a native library that a tool
should link with.

The following native library kinds are available:

When attribute link appears without a native library kind, its native
library kind defaults to dylib. Native library kind framework is only valid
on macOS targets.

If attribute link appears without a WebAssembly module name, then the
WebAssembly module name defaults to env.

When attribute link appears with raw-dylib as the native library
kind, the supplied name must include the file extension.

When attribute link appears with raw-dylib as the native library
kind, the [external function]s and [external static]s of the related
external block shall not be subject to attribute no_mangle.

paragraphs.fls_yslpkdngo8hj: Attribute link shall apply to [external block]s.
paragraphs.fls_6rohnk4swj6c: Attribute :dc:link shall specify the name of a native library that a tool should link with.
paragraphs.fls_o83pf3bcrzma: The following native library kinds are available: .. list-table:: -
paragraphs.fls_1tdheukgm6ai: When attribute link appears without a native library kind, its native library kind defaults to dylib. Native library kind framework is only valid on macOS targets.
paragraphs.fls_3i9ijypnh8nx: If attribute link appears without a WebAssembly module name, then the WebAssembly module name defaults to env.
paragraphs.fls_iDjcQczFQknm: When attribute link appears with raw-dylib as the native library kind, the supplied name must include the file extension.
paragraphs.fls_rcERq1PfKPJI: When attribute link appears with raw-dylib as the native library kind, the [external function]s and [external static]s of the related external block shall not be subject to attribute no_mangle.

paragraphs.syntax_1:
LinkContent ::=
       $$link$$ $$($$ LinkOption $$)$$

   LinkOption ::=
       NativeLibraryName
     | NativeLibraryNameWithKind
     | WebAssemblyModuleName

   NativeLibraryName ::=
       $$name$$ $$=$$ StringLiteral

   NativeLibraryNameWithKind ::=
       NativeLibraryName $$,$$ NativeLibraryKind

   WebAssemblyModuleName ::=
       $$wasm_import_module$$ $$=$$ StringLiteral

   NativeLibraryKind ::=
       $$kind$$ $$=$$ $$"$$ NativeLibraryKindType $$"$$

   NativeLibraryKindType ::=
  ...

sections.title: Attribute ``link_name``
sections.content:
Attribute link_name

Attribute link_name shall apply to [external function]s and
[external static]s.

Attribute :dc:`link_name` shall specify the linking symbol of the related
external function or external static.

Attribute link_name shall not be applied to [external function]s
and [external static]s that are annotated with Attribute
link_ordinal.

paragraphs.fls_g09jhukl0ez2: Attribute link_name shall apply to [external function]s and [external static]s.
paragraphs.fls_d00wni4edi8f: Attribute :dc:link_name shall specify the linking symbol of the related external function or external static.
paragraphs.fls_0Athv8KFA5FO: Attribute link_name shall not be applied to [external function]s and [external static]s that are annotated with Attribute link_ordinal.

sections.title: Attribute ``link_section``
sections.content:
Attribute link_section

Attribute link_section shall apply to [function]s and
[static]s.

Attribute :dc:`link_section` specifies the object file section where the
symbol of the related function or static will be placed.

paragraphs.fls_5loqzajiz34m: Attribute link_section shall apply to [function]s and [static]s.
paragraphs.fls_cyxk12wuicml: Attribute :dc:link_section specifies the object file section where the symbol of the related function or static will be placed.

sections.title: Attribute ``link_ordinal``
sections.content:
Attribute link_ordinal

Attribute link_ordinal shall apply to [external function]s and
[external static]s.

The related extern block of the [external function] or
[external static] shall be subject to attribute link with
raw-dylib as the native library kind.

Attribute :dc:`link_ordinal` shall specify the linking symbol of the
related external function or external static by ordinal number.

paragraphs.fls_fuv29BIqcawW: Attribute link_ordinal shall apply to [external function]s and [external static]s.
paragraphs.fls_qh5sXG4znAXa: The related extern block of the [external function] or [external static] shall be subject to attribute link with raw-dylib as the native library kind.
paragraphs.fls_ASnJJiXWGlKI: Attribute :dc:link_ordinal shall specify the linking symbol of the related external function or external static by ordinal number.

sections.title: Attribute ``no_link``
sections.content:
Attribute no_link

Attribute no_link shall apply to [crate import]s.

Attribute :dc:`no_link` indicates that the imported external crate
will not be linked into the resulting binary or library.

paragraphs.fls_ayhn6g6sgt3h: Attribute no_link shall apply to [crate import]s.
paragraphs.fls_76ox8n3eef5: Attribute :dc:no_link indicates that the imported external crate will not be linked into the resulting binary or library.

sections.title: Attribute ``no_main``
sections.content:
Attribute no_main

Attribute no_main shall apply to the crate root module.

Attribute :dc:`no_main` indicates that the symbols of the
program entry point will not be present in a binary.

paragraphs.fls_84a9k0fzmnfk: Attribute no_main shall apply to the crate root module.
paragraphs.fls_6qig3s3qpj0i: Attribute :dc:no_main indicates that the symbols of the program entry point will not be present in a binary.

sections.title: Attribute ``no_mangle``
sections.content:
Attribute no_mangle

Attribute no_mangle has no effect on [construct]s other than
[function]s and [static]s.

Attribute :dc:`no_mangle` indicates that the name of the related
function or static will be used as the symbol for that function
or static.

Attribute no_mangle causes the related function or static to
be publicly exported from the produced library or object file.

An exported function is a function subject to attribute
no_mangle.

An exported static is a static subject to attribute
no_mangle.

paragraphs.fls_q5swm5meafmx: Attribute no_mangle has no effect on [construct]s other than [function]s and [static]s.
paragraphs.fls_esaew4fqk8mm: Attribute :dc:no_mangle indicates that the name of the related function or static will be used as the symbol for that function or static.
paragraphs.fls_lvnclpxbye9u: Attribute no_mangle causes the related function or static to be publicly exported from the produced library or object file.
paragraphs.fls_VKuSiswPMll7: An exported function is a function subject to attribute no_mangle.
paragraphs.fls_I029Rvr5BX5P: An exported static is a static subject to attribute no_mangle.

sections.title: Attribute ``repr``
sections.content:
Attribute repr

 RepresentationList ::=
 Representation ($$,$$ Representation)* $$,$$?

 Representation ::=
 RepresentationKind
 | Alignment

 RepresentationKind ::=
 PrimitiveRepresentation
 | $$C$$
 | $$Rust$$
 | $$transparent$$

 Alignment ::=
 AlignmentDecrease
 | AlignmentIncrease

 PrimitiveRepresentation ::=
 $$i8$$
 | $$i16$$
 | $$i32$$
 | $$i64$$
 | $$i128$$
 | $$isize$$
 | $$u8$$
 | $$u16$$
 | $$u32$$
 | $$u64$$
 | $$u128$$
 | $$usize$$

 AlignmentDecrease ::=
 $$packed$$

 AlignmentIncrease ::=
 $$align$$ $$($$ DecimalLiteral $$)$$

Attribute repr shall apply to [abstract data type]s.

Attribute :dc:`repr` shall indicate the type representation of the
related type.

paragraphs.fls_vetjq9sw84qc: Attribute repr shall apply to [abstract data type]s.
paragraphs.fls_is2esjz1sy36: Attribute :dc:repr shall indicate the type representation of the related type.

paragraphs.syntax_1:
ReprContent ::=
       $$repr$$ $$($$ RepresentationList $$)$$

   RepresentationList ::=
       Representation ($$,$$ Representation)* $$,$$?

   Representation ::=
       RepresentationKind
     | Alignment

   RepresentationKind ::=
       PrimitiveRepresentation
     | $$C$$
     | $$Rust$$
     | $$transparent$$

   Alignment ::=
       AlignmentDecrease
     | AlignmentIncrease

   PrimitiveRepresentation ::=
       $$i8$$
     | $$i16$$
     | $$i32$$
     | $$i64$$
     | $$i128$$
     |...

sections.title: Attribute ``unsafe``
sections.content:
Attribute unsafe

Attribute :dc:`unsafe` is used to indicate that an attribute is unsafe <unsafe operation>.

Attribute unsafe shall apply to what the contained attribute applies to.

Attribute unsafe does not affect the behavior of the contained attribute.

The contained attribute shall be one of the following:

* Attribute no_mangle

* Attribute export_name

* Attribute link_section

* Attribute naked

paragraphs.fls_z5DTDKM9mU3o: Attribute :dc:unsafe is used to indicate that an attribute is unsafe <unsafe operation>.
paragraphs.fls_5pjo3nGOxbVw: Attribute unsafe shall apply to what the contained attribute applies to.
paragraphs.fls_gpxlWbQUNsj8: Attribute unsafe does not affect the behavior of the contained attribute.
paragraphs.fls_PhrfxSBvXTPV: The contained attribute shall be one of the following:

sections.title: Attribute ``used``
sections.content:
Attribute used

Attribute used shall apply to [static]s.

Attribute :dc:`used` forces a tool to keep the related static in the
output object file even if the static is not used or referenced by other
[item]s in the crate.

paragraphs.fls_k293nzcffks4: Attribute :dc:used forces a tool to keep the related static in the output object file even if the static is not used or referenced by other [item]s in the crate.

sections.title: Limits Attributes
sections.content: Limits Attributes

sections.title: Attribute ``recursion_limit``
sections.content:
Attribute recursion_limit

Attribute recursion_limit shall apply to the crate root module.

Attribute :dc:`recursion_limit` sets the maximum depth of
macro expansion and auto-dereferencing.

paragraphs.fls_o55cxc67sya7: Attribute recursion_limit shall apply to the crate root module.
paragraphs.fls_o9p8fa8zhe15: Attribute :dc:recursion_limit sets the maximum depth of macro expansion and auto-dereferencing.

sections.title: Attribute ``type_length_limit``
sections.content:
Attribute type_length_limit

Attribute type_length_limit shall apply to the
crate root module.

Attribute :dc:`type_length_limit` sets the maximum number of
[generic substitution]s for [type parameter]s when constructing a
concrete type.

paragraphs.fls_dfnkzj8ob3uq: Attribute type_length_limit shall apply to the crate root module.
paragraphs.fls_61vt1r8g51nh: Attribute :dc:type_length_limit sets the maximum number of [generic substitution]s for [type parameter]s when constructing a concrete type.

sections.title: Macros Attributes
sections.content: Macros Attributes

sections.title: Attribute ``collapse_debuginfo``
sections.content:
Attribute collapse_debuginfo

 CollapseDebuginfoKind ::=
 $$no$$
 | $$external$$
 | $$yes$$

Attribute collapse_debuginfo shall apply to [declarative macro]s.

Attribute :dc:`collapse_debuginfo` changes the debug location information
for the expanded code of the declarative macro to its invocation site. This
repeats recursively to the top most expansion of a declarative macro that
is not annotated with attribute collapse_debuginfo.

paragraphs.fls_EzKHtWHmXMAZ: Attribute collapse_debuginfo shall apply to [declarative macro]s.
paragraphs.fls_BCvJpfQMYEcD: Attribute :dc:collapse_debuginfo changes the debug location information for the expanded code of the declarative macro to its invocation site. This repeats recursively to the top most expansion of a declarative macro that is not annotated with attribute collapse_debuginfo.

sections.title: Attribute ``macro_export``
sections.content:
Attribute macro_export

Attribute macro_export shall apply to [declarative macro]s.

Attribute :dc:`macro_export` changes the visibility of the related
declarative macro to public visibility and introduces the name
of the declarative macro into the item scope of the
crate root module.

paragraphs.fls_3ma7zkk6john: Attribute macro_export shall apply to [declarative macro]s.
paragraphs.fls_h26iw5wh4lla: Attribute :dc:macro_export changes the visibility of the related declarative macro to public visibility and introduces the name of the declarative macro into the item scope of the crate root module.

sections.title: Attribute ``macro_use``
sections.content:
Attribute macro_use

 ImportedMacroList ::=
 $$($$ IdentifierList $$)$$

Attribute macro_use shall apply to [crate import]s and
[module]s.

An ImportedMacroList enumerates macros-to-import. A macro-to-import shall
be subject to attribute macro_export.

When applied to a crate import, attribute :dc:`macro_use`
imports from the related crate either:

* The enumerated macros-to-import, or

* If no macros-to-import have been specified, all [macro]s subject to
 attribute macro_export.

When applied to a module, attribute macro_use extends the
textual macro scope of the related macro.

paragraphs.fls_uua0nthq9id: Attribute macro_use shall apply to [crate import]s and [module]s.
paragraphs.fls_oq4kyo5z5tj5: An ImportedMacroList enumerates macros-to-import. A macro-to-import shall be subject to attribute macro_export.
paragraphs.fls_skexvtpbjknn: When applied to a crate import, attribute :dc:macro_use imports from the related crate either:
paragraphs.fls_eha2hoey857x: If no macros-to-import have been specified, all [macro]s subject to attribute macro_export.
paragraphs.fls_p6jlgmn2sg7j: When applied to a module, attribute macro_use extends the textual macro scope of the related macro.

sections.title: Attribute ``proc_macro``
sections.content:
Attribute proc_macro

Attribute proc_macro shall apply to public [function]s in the
crate root module of a proc-macro crate.

Attribute :dc:`proc_macro` turns the related function into a
function-like macro.

paragraphs.fls_u48dtmh97g: Attribute proc_macro shall apply to public [function]s in the crate root module of a proc-macro crate.
paragraphs.fls_t4ez0zg1m569: Attribute :dc:proc_macro turns the related function into a function-like macro.

sections.title: Attribute ``proc_macro_attribute``
sections.content:
Attribute proc_macro_attribute

Attribute proc_macro_attribute shall apply to public [function]s
in the crate root module of a proc-macro crate.

Attribute :dc:`proc_macro_attribute` turns the related function into
an attribute macro.

paragraphs.fls_huznzmkuhdky: Attribute proc_macro_attribute shall apply to public [function]s in the crate root module of a proc-macro crate.
paragraphs.fls_gc3ly8fsodf1: Attribute :dc:proc_macro_attribute turns the related function into an attribute macro.

sections.title: Attribute ``proc_macro_derive``
sections.content:
Attribute proc_macro_derive

 DeriveName ::=
 Name

 HelperAttributeList ::=
 $$attributes$$ $$($$ IdentifierList $$)$$

Attribute proc_macro_derive shall apply to public [function]s in
the crate root module of a proc-macro crate.

Attribute :dc:`proc_macro_derive` turns the related function into a
derive macro, where DeriveName defines the name of the
derive macro available to attribute derive.

The HelperAttributeList declares the [derive helper attribute]s of
the derive macro.

paragraphs.fls_l82yswg0k3px: Attribute proc_macro_derive shall apply to public [function]s in the crate root module of a proc-macro crate.
paragraphs.fls_ir9i4i2x5gyx: Attribute :dc:proc_macro_derive turns the related function into a derive macro, where DeriveName defines the name of the derive macro available to attribute derive.
paragraphs.fls_NydVxyb43TH6: The HelperAttributeList declares the [derive helper attribute]s of the derive macro.

paragraphs.syntax_1:
ProcMacroDeriveContent ::=
       $$proc_macro_derive$$ $$($$ DeriveName ($$,$$ HelperAttributeList)? $$)$$

   DeriveName ::=
       Name

   HelperAttributeList ::=
       $$attributes$$ $$($$ IdentifierList $$)$$

sections.title: Modules Attributes
sections.content: Modules Attributes

sections.title: Attribute ``path``
sections.content:
Attribute path

Attribute path shall apply to [module]s.

Attribute :dc:`path` specifies the module path of the respective
module as a string literal.

A tool is free to define the format of a module path.

paragraphs.fls_qb6anohvc03k: Attribute :dc:path specifies the module path of the respective module as a string literal.
paragraphs.fls_18tcecx4p2wp: A tool is free to define the format of a module path.

sections.title: Prelude Attributes
sections.content: Prelude Attributes

sections.title: Attribute ``no_implicit_prelude``
sections.content:
Attribute no_implicit_prelude

The inner attribute version of attribute no_implicit_prelude
shall apply to the crate root module or to [module]s.

The outer attribute version of attribute no_implicit_prelude
shall apply to [module]s.

Attribute :dc:`no_implicit_prelude` prevents the import of the
external prelude, the standard library prelude, and the tool
prelude.

paragraphs.fls_tki5k5uo74gw: The inner attribute version of attribute no_implicit_prelude shall apply to the crate root module or to [module]s.
paragraphs.fls_cmrqxc5oax4r: The outer attribute version of attribute no_implicit_prelude shall apply to [module]s.
paragraphs.fls_c7v2hbdb7g2d: Attribute :dc:no_implicit_prelude prevents the import of the external prelude, the standard library prelude, and the tool prelude.

sections.title: Attribute ``no_std``
sections.content:
Attribute no_std

Attribute no_std shall apply to the crate root module.

Attribute :dc:`no_std` has the following effects:

* Prevents the import of the standard library prelude.

* Imports the core prelude.

* Imports all [declarative macro]s subject to attribute
 macro_export of the core crate into the macro_use prelude.

paragraphs.fls_qnxihxsvkyf6: Attribute no_std shall apply to the crate root module.
paragraphs.fls_ve1shwjq09pl: Prevents the import of the standard library prelude.
paragraphs.fls_lxkd6hdboav4: Imports all [declarative macro]s subject to attribute macro_export of the core crate into the macro_use prelude.

sections.title: Runtime Attributes
sections.content: Runtime Attributes

sections.title: Attribute ``global_allocator``
sections.content:
Attribute global_allocator

Attribute global_allocator shall apply to [static]s whose
[type]s implement the core::alloc::GlobalAlloc trait.

Attribute :dc:`global_allocator` sets the global allocator to the related
static.

paragraphs.fls_5b8aewlgeon8: Attribute global_allocator shall apply to [static]s whose [type]s implement the core::alloc::GlobalAlloc trait.
paragraphs.fls_homoidh8mu1r: Attribute :dc:global_allocator sets the global allocator to the related static.

sections.title: Attribute ``panic_handler``
sections.content:
Attribute panic_handler

Attribute panic_handler shall apply to [function]s with the
following restrictions:

* It lacks [function qualifier]s,

* Its ABI is Rust,

* It lacks [generic parameter]s,

* It has a single function parameter whose type is &
 core::panic::PanicInfo,

* It has the never type as its return type,

* It lacks a where clause,

* It has a function body.

Attribute :dc:`panic_handler` indicates that its related function
defines the behavior of [panic]s.

A crate graph shall contain exactly one function subject to
attribute panic_handler.

paragraphs.fls_ryz8qy1wdnma: Attribute panic_handler shall apply to [function]s with the following restrictions:
paragraphs.fls_ZEjvn4mmfSct: It has a single function parameter whose type is & core::panic::PanicInfo,
paragraphs.fls_iWPw0QFE5TrP: It has the never type as its return type,
paragraphs.fls_8gqun8lma9wz: Attribute :dc:panic_handler indicates that its related function defines the behavior of [panic]s.
paragraphs.fls_ka66jcu8gir7: A crate graph shall contain exactly one function subject to attribute panic_handler.

sections.title: Attribute ``windows_subsystem``
sections.content:
Attribute windows_subsystem

 SubsystemKind ::=
 $$console$$
 | $$windows$$

Attribute windows_subsystem shall apply to the crate root module
of a binary crate.

Attribute :dc:`windows_subsystem` specifies the subsystem on Windows.

If attribute windows_subsystem is missing, the subsystem of the
related binary crate defaults to console.

paragraphs.fls_7mzjahvdzpy5: Attribute windows_subsystem shall apply to the crate root module of a binary crate.
paragraphs.fls_t3c0t3lcnebk: Attribute :dc:windows_subsystem specifies the subsystem on Windows.
paragraphs.fls_go7pfkgpjk2t: If attribute windows_subsystem is missing, the subsystem of the related binary crate defaults to console.

sections.title: Testing Attributes
sections.content: Testing Attributes

sections.title: Attribute ``ignore``
sections.content:
Attribute ignore

 IgnoreReason ::=
 $$=$$ StringLiteral

Attribute ignore shall apply to [testing function]s.

Attribute :dc:`ignore` prevents the execution of its related
testing function.

paragraphs.fls_qmdylxse9yhu: Attribute ignore shall apply to [testing function]s.
paragraphs.fls_9m8e59fc1tyh: Attribute :dc:ignore prevents the execution of its related testing function.

sections.title: Attribute ``should_panic``
sections.content:
Attribute should_panic

 ExpectedPanicMessage ::=
 $$($$ $$expected$$ $$=$$ StringLiteral $$)$$

Attribute should_panic shall apply to [testing function]s.

Attribute :dc:`should_panic` indicates that for the related
testing function to pass, it should panic.

If ExpectedPanicMessage is specified, then the related
testing function passes only when the panic message contains the
ExpectedPanicMessage.

paragraphs.fls_w7dq8gnzel36: Attribute should_panic shall apply to [testing function]s.
paragraphs.fls_bm5x846zfnb8: Attribute :dc:should_panic indicates that for the related testing function to pass, it should panic.
paragraphs.fls_bcoq5aus8nkr: If ExpectedPanicMessage is specified, then the related testing function passes only when the panic message contains the ExpectedPanicMessage.

sections.title: Attribute ``test``
sections.content:
Attribute test

Attribute test shall apply to [function]s that:

* Is not an async function, and

* Is not an unsafe function, and

* Lacks [generic parameter]s, and

* Lacks [function parameter]s, and

Attribute :dc:`test` indicates that the respective function is a
testing function.

A testing function that returns the unit type passes when it
terminates and does not panic.

A testing function that returns core::result::Result<(), E> passes when
it returns core::result::Result::Ok(()).

A testing function that does not terminate shall pass and fail according to
the tool.

paragraphs.fls_o2elhg5w1rj9: Attribute test shall apply to [function]s that:
paragraphs.fls_ert22u8rvkxt: Is not an async function, and
paragraphs.fls_c9ckjrq6emdj: Is not an unsafe function, and
paragraphs.fls_ze6cs75y9aft: Attribute :dc:test indicates that the respective function is a testing function.
paragraphs.fls_pcs0prrh23y3: A testing function that returns the unit type passes when it terminates and does not panic.
paragraphs.fls_niky8lbkvej9: A testing function that returns core::result::Result<(), E> passes when it returns core::result::Result::Ok(()).
paragraphs.fls_qfuntdm2g184: A testing function that does not terminate shall pass and fail according to the tool.

sections.title: Type Attributes
sections.content: Type Attributes

sections.title: Attribute ``non_exhaustive``
sections.content:
Attribute non_exhaustive

Attribute non_exhaustive shall apply to [enum type]s,
[enum variant]s, and [struct type]s.

Attribute :dc:`non_exhaustive` indicates that the related
abstract data type or enum variant may have more [field]s or
[enum variant]s added in the future. A type subject to attribute
non_exhaustive is referred to as a non-exhaustive type.

A non-exhaustive type shall not be constructed outside of its defining
crate.

An enum variant subject to attribute non_exhaustive is referred
to as a non-exhaustive variant.

A non-exhaustive variant shall not be constructed outside of its defining
crate.

Pattern matching a non-exhaustive variant shall require a
struct pattern with a rest pattern outside its defining crate.

Pattern matching a non-exhaustive variant does not contribute towards
the exhaustiveness of [match arm]s.

paragraphs.fls_szvrd79cgzsg: Attribute non_exhaustive shall apply to [enum type]s, [enum variant]s, and [struct type]s.
paragraphs.fls_1of56vl2ewq0: Attribute :dc:non_exhaustive indicates that the related abstract data type or enum variant may have more [field]s or [enum variant]s added in the future. A type subject to attribute non_exhaustive is referred to as a non-exhaustive type.
paragraphs.fls_hkyzdmmdyoin: A non-exhaustive type shall not be constructed outside of its defining crate.
paragraphs.fls_7b0fvwrmz0mh: An enum variant subject to attribute non_exhaustive is referred to as a non-exhaustive variant.
paragraphs.fls_oqfrg9tqgaj8: A non-exhaustive variant shall not be constructed outside of its defining crate.
paragraphs.fls_aql3c89840ix: Pattern matching a non-exhaustive variant shall require a struct pattern with a rest pattern outside its defining crate.
paragraphs.fls_cez7yxfc376c: Pattern matching a non-exhaustive variant does not contribute towards the exhaustiveness of [match arm]s.
